data:
Slang

Slang is a type of language that consists of words and phrases that are regarded as very informal, are more common in speech than writing and are typically restricted to a particular context or group of people.

awesome - great and impressive.

ball - a fun time.

bang (1) - a very powerful thing.

bang (2) - a powerful effect.

barf (1) - vomit.

bazillion - an infinite number of something.

beans - money.

beat - tired.

biker - a motorcycle rider.

booboo - a mistake.

booze - alcohol.

boss - employer.

bread - money.

brew - a drink that has been cooked/boiled.

bushed - extremely tired.

catch some rays - get some sunshine.

cheesy - cheap or of low quality.

chicken - coward.

cool - excellent.

couch potato - a person who sits and watches too much tv.

crap - something worthless.

dicey - unpredictable; risky.

dirt - extremely bad person.

dude - a male.

dynamite - powerful; excellent.

dinosaur - something old fashioned or out of date.

evil - great; excellent.

eyeball - to stare long and hard at someone or something.

fab - fabulous.

flaky - unpredictable.

flashback - sudden memory.

flick - movie.

fox - attractive, alluring person.

freebie - something that does not cost money.

get it - to understand something.

Got it - I understand something.

glitch - flaw.

goof - a silly and foolish person.

goofy - silly.

grabbers - hands.

grand - one thousand dollars.

grub - food.

grubby - not clean.

gut - a person's stomach; belly.

guts - courage.

hairy - difficult; dangerous.

hang a left - turn left.

hang a right - turn right.

hot (1) - popular.

hot (2) - attractive.

humungous - really big.

hyper - overly excited.

I'm outta here - I'm leaving; I'm departing.

in - fashionable.

Out - not fashionable anymore.

john - toilet.

K - a thousand dollars.

kick back - relax and enjoy.

kick off - die.

killer - something exceptional or great.

knock - condemn.

laid back - relaxed; calm.

lame - incompetent.

lip - to talk back.

luck out - to be lucky or fortunate.

make waves - cause problems.

mega - big.

mellow - relaxed.

munch out - to eat voraciously.

nada - nothing in Spanish.

neat - cool; great.

nut - odd or crazy person.

okay - decent.

OK - okay.

pad - someone's home.

party - to celebrate.

party animal - someone that loves parties.

paws - hands.

peanuts - very little money.

pig out - eat too much.

pro - someone who's good at something; professional.

psycho - crazy person.

rat - a despicable person.

riot, a - something or someone very funny.

rip off (1) - stealing.

rip off (2) - overpriced.

rubbish - not true.

rug rat - a baby.

shades - sunglasses.

silks - clothing.

smarts - intelligence.

specs - eyeglasses.

split - to leave.

street smart - knowledgeable about city life.

suck - to be bad and unacceptable.

threads - clothing.

ticker - the heart.

tints - sunglasses.

totally - really; completely.

turkey - dumb person.

uptight - nervous; anxious.

vanilla - plain.

wheels - car; motorcycle.

whiz - someone who shows a special talent for something.

wimpy - weak.

Winks - get some sleep.

zip - nothing.

Zilch - nothing.
